examples.translation: He thinks ([in a mocking manner] imagines) that the universe was created in six days.
Who do you think you are?

examples.text: Tam çıktığımı sanırken, beni geri çektiler.
examples.translation: Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish صانمق (sanmak, “to deem, think, suppose, imagine”), from Proto-Turkic *sā-n-mak (“to be counted, be regarded”), originally passive/reflexive of *sā-mak (“to think, count, regard”). See saymak (“to count, regard”). Cognate with Karakhanid سَنْماقْ (sanmāq, “to be counted, be regarded, to think”).
